designScenario.name: Pressurization System
designScenario.description: The Pressurization System is designed to regulate cabin pressure within safe and comfortable parameters during aircraft operations. It ensures the cabin maintains a pressure equivalent to sea-level conditions (1 atm) at cruising altitudes, preventing altitude sickness and structural stress. The system employs outflow valves, pressure sensors, and a control unit to modulate airflow and maintain pressure equilibrium. It is engineered for redundancy, rapid response, and compliance with aviation safety standards, integrating with the broader Environmental Control System (ECS) for cohesive operation.

details.description: The system shall maintain cabin pressure between 0.8 atm and 1.2 atm at all flight phases using regulated airflow through outflow valves and pressurization controllers.
Automatically adjust cabin pressure during ascent and descent to match external atmospheric conditions, ensuring passenger comfort and aircraft structural integrity.
Initiate emergency depressurization protocols if cabin pressure exceeds 1.2 atm or drops below 0.8 atm, including automatic valve activation and crew alerts.
Ensure pressure adjustments occur within 5 seconds of detecting deviations from the setpoint to maintain stability.
Implement dual redundant pressure sensors and backup control channels to mitigate single-point failures.
Provide a dedicated cabin pressure display unit with real-time data and fault indicators accessible to the flight crew.

systemComponents.name: Outflow Valve Assembly
systemComponents.description: Controls airflow out of the cabin to regulate pressure. Includes variable-position valves and actuators.

subComponents.name: Primary Outflow Valve
subComponents.description: Adjustable valve that modulates cabin pressure by varying airflow rate.

subComponents.name: Actuator Motor
subComponents.description: Electric motor driving the valve position based on control signals.

subComponents.name: Position Sensor
subComponents.description: Monitors valve position to confirm alignment with control commands.

systemComponents.name: Pressure Control Unit
systemComponents.description: Central processor managing pressure regulation algorithms and valve actuation commands.

subComponents.name: Pressure Regulator
subComponents.description: PID controller calculating required valve adjustments based on sensor inputs.

subComponents.name: Input/Output Interface
subComponents.description: Connects to pressure sensors, valves, and cockpit displays.

systemComponents.name: Pressure Sensor Array
systemComponents.description: Network of sensors distributed in the cabin and fuselage to measure pressure differentials.

subComponents.name: Differential Pressure Sensor
subComponents.description: Measures pressure difference between cabin and external atmosphere.

subComponents.name: Altitude Sensor
subComponents.description: Detects aircraft altitude to adjust pressure setpoints during climb/descent.

systemComponents.name: Cabin Pressure Display Unit
systemComponents.description: Cockpit-mounted display showing real-time cabin pressure, altitude, and system status.

systemComponents.name: Relief Valve System
systemComponents.description: Emergency pressure relief valves that open automatically if pressure exceeds safe thresholds.

subComponents.name: Overpressure Relief Valve
subComponents.description: Mechanical valve activated by pressure differential exceeding 1.2 atm.

subComponents.name: Underpressure Relief Valve
subComponents.description: Prevents cabin collapse by closing if pressure drops below 0.8 atm.

relationships.description: The Outflow Valve Assembly receives control signals from the Pressure Control Unit to adjust valve positions.
Sensor data from the Pressure Sensor Array is aggregated by the Pressure Control Unit for decision-making.
The Pressure Control Unit transmits real-time pressure data to the Cabin Pressure Display Unit for crew monitoring.
The Relief Valve System is a safety-critical component under direct control of the Pressure Control Unit during emergencies.

attributes.name: pressureRange
attributes.description: Operating pressure range maintained within the cabin during flight.

attributes.name: responseTime
attributes.description: Maximum allowed time for the system to respond to pressure deviations.

attributes.name: valveFlowRate
attributes.description: Adjustable airflow capacity of the primary outflow valve.

attributes.name: sensorAccuracy
attributes.description: Precision of differential pressure sensors in measuring cabin pressure.

attributes.name: redundancyLevel
attributes.description: Number of backup components for critical pressure control functions.

comments.body: Controls cabin pressure to maintain safe altitude equivalent pressure
